comment: Darker color than normal. Sweetish smell, maybe a bit of rye. Can tatse the extra grains, rye in it. A bit hot at the end, but not too bad really. Very slight hint of chocolate at the end.
A little over-priced, but delicious and smooth. Moderate body, with strong notes of toast and cereal.
I like this one, it tastes sweet rich caramely. I usually drink this in old fashioned's. Pretty expensive but I think it's worth it.
It's ok but wouldn't pick it over other choices
One of my favorites. The only reason it gets four stars is because of the price. $45-50. Should be about $30 for the size.
Love this! Yes, it's expensive. But it is so smooth and tasty.
Tastes like tequila. Not the greatest but not the worst.
Half of a bottle, half the quality, twice the price. Hmmm....
Nothing stuck out to me on this one...hence middle of the road.  Don't need to retry.
Had with EJ & Kristien in Pleasantville.  Good but a bit rough.

The nose is all chemical and slightly similar to mineral spirits.  The palate starts off as all grains and alcohol.  It finishes sweet and a lot of cinnamon.  The finish is slightly similar to Fireball.

This tastes like a very mild rye, with maybe malt notes next. Silky, and definitely a pleasant sipper, probably evidence of a good mash from people who know what they're doing. But I'm not going to lie, I wanted to taste each grain distinctly and blatantly. The price gives me pause, but this was worth trying. 4/11/17
Flavorful, burn hits all at once after smooth entry
Dark in appearance, heavy pine notes and sweetish aftertaste. It's ok, but not worth £50 for 35cl. Elijah Craig 12 is a better drop for 2/3 the price.
3 Stars - A very different bourbon. Almost a rum type flavor. Still, very flavorful with a little bite. Very smooth with a long building finish.
The tiniest bit of bite but I’d definitely drink again
Very very young, a bit of plastic taste, no burn.
Nice and middle of the road. Ok to sip but can be mixed too
A unique flavor from the NY corn. It finishes like roasted corn with a bit of a sweet charred flavor. Unique but good.
cherry and rose, sherry wood, oak smoke, stone and slight peat
Has a nice mix of rye taste followed by a more bourbon finish.
Tried this at Whiskey Washback. Smooth, has notes of apple, caramel, pepper, and corn, but tastes bland.
I was thoroughly looking forward to trying this four grain and after trying it twice, both neat and on the rocks, I have been left unimpressed.
Smooth and buttery with spicy finish.
Waxy nose. Definitely get the pitted berries. Not bad but not the best either.

The nose is a bit hit low in the glass, but floral and pleasant up high.   The palette is grain and simple up front but finishes with enjoyable spice. A drop of d/w opens both nose and palette.  Enjoyable.
Floral and sweet. Heavy corn aftertaste.
Very smooth with a little build of heat in the aftertastes but just the right amount.
Solid offering. Slightly spicy, a little fruity
